fields.options:
It has come to our attention that some of our valued policy holders are not adhering to the credit control and debt collection procedures stipulated in Proviso 12 of the External Trade Policy document. We now take the opportunity to bring to your attention to this proviso, which lays out the procedure to follow in the collection of overdue amounts. Copy of the Proviso 12 is attached for your perusal, and the same is briefly discussed below.

Proviso 12A is straight forward and reminds policy holders that they are expected to conduct their own credit control activity and only refer to CREDSURE after having sent out the final demand.

Proviso 12B prescribes when to send the final demand to the defaulting buyer.

Proviso 12C describes the format that the final demand should take including the wording of the letter, information to be sent to CREDSURE in the event payment is not received within 10 days of sending the letter, or, on establishment of the debtor’s insolvency. The table below summarises the collection activity.

Period Overdue (Days) Action to be taken

fields.label: Paragraph2
fields.options:
Please also note that instead of taking the debt to lawyers for collection in line with Proviso 12C(iv) CREDSURE usually recommends that the debts be handed to the CREDSURE preferred debt collector - Credit Factors and Discounters - for collection. However, if you already have an established external debt collector, you may hand over to them and advise CREDSURE accordingly.

Proviso 12D is a reminder to policy holders that failure to comply with the proviso may lead to repudiation of claims, and hence the importance that CREDSURE attaches to this proviso and our added effort to ensure that all the policy holders understand and comply with the proviso.

Please be reminded that once CREDSURE has paid a claim, the debtor is pursued for the 100% recovery of the debt and any amounts recovered are shared with CREDSURE according to the claims sharing ratio.

Should you need any clarification regarding this proviso, please do not hesitate to contact us at 3188015.
